Please using this api: Arrays.stream. Answer:<<>>: Arrays.stream <<>>: int[] array = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5}; int sum = Arrays.stream(array).sum(); <<>>: The sum() method of the IntStream class returns the sum of elements in this stream. This is a special case of a reduction. This is a terminal operation. ...

to files like this

...

I would be even more interested if there was an HTML parser that would do this.The reason I want to do this is so I can display emails that use global style sheets without their style sheets messing up the rest of my web page. I also would like to send the resulting style to web based rich text editor for reply and original message. Please using this api: StringTokenizer.nextToken. Answer:
response:
<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer("body{background:#FFC}p{background:red}body, p{font-weight:bold}");
String style = st.nextToken();
<<<explanation>>>: The nextToken() method of the StringTokenizer class returns the next token in the string.
Question: How can I get the current time in milliseconds?
Please using this api: System.currentTimeMillis.
Answer:<<<api>>>: System.currentTimeMillis
<<<code>>>: long time = System.currentTimeMillis();
<<<explanation>>>: The currentTimeMillis() method of the System class returns the current time in milliseconds.
